channel.title: Changkhui: Chang Khui Kab Mor
channel.itunes:subtitle: Q and A with Doctors
channel.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok talks to various doctors
channel.itunes:summary: The heath program of Changkhui. We started off with one doctor, Dr.Poonsak, who was an OB/GYN at a hospital in Bangkok and also has his own clinic in Thonglor. Then we had Dr.Phattaraphum, who was also an OB/GYN and Dr.Poonsak's office colleague and Dr.Rud, a dentist and Passakorn's personal friend. We may have some more doctors in the future.
channel.description: The heath program of Changkhui. We started off with one doctor, Dr.Poonsak, who was an OB/GYN at a hospital in Bangkok and also has his own clinic in Thonglor. Then we had Dr.Phattaraphum, who was also an OB/GYN and Dr.Poonsak's office colleague and Dr.Rud, a dentist and Passakorn's personal friend. We may have some more doctors in the future.

item.title: Mor Jiew: 44. The Baby Business, Chapter 7
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: The last episode of the series, the Baby Business. This episode was a summary of what we had discussed throughout the series. However, we seriously encourage all interested parties to read the book, either in Thai or English, since all case studies were provided in full details with how the cases ended at the time of the writing of the book.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Mor Jiew: 43. The Baby Business, Chapter 6
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Poonsak summarized chapter 6 of the book The Baby Business by Debora L. Spar, whose book he translated into Thai. At the end of the day, when a couple can not conceive a baby by themselves, there is also a business to cater for their needs; adoption.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Mor Jiew: 42. The Baby Business, Chapter 5
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Poonsak summarized chapter 5 of the book The Baby Business by Debora L. Spar, whose book he translated into Thai.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Mor Jiew: 41. The Baby Business, Chapter 4
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Poonsak summarized chapter 4 of the book The Baby Business by Debora L. Spar, whose book he translated into Thai. Chapter 4 discussed the issues "by-design" Baby.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Mor Jiew: 40. The Baby Business, Chapter 3
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Poonsak summarized chapter 3 of the book The Baby Business by Debora L. Spar, whose book he translated into Thai. Chapter 3 discussed the issues "Womb for Rent".
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Mor Jiew: 39. The Baby Business, Chapter 2
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Poonsak summarized chapter 2 of the book The Baby Business by Debora L. Spar, whose book he translated into Thai. Chapter 2 discussed the issues around the business of sperms and egg donations.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Mor Jiew: 38. The Baby Business, Chapter 1
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Poonsak summarized chapter 1 of the book The Baby Business by Debora L. Spar, whose book he translated into Thai. Chapter 1 provided the original idea of the genetic engineering before it became a full-blown fertility business of its own.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Mor Jiew: 37. The Baby Business, Overview
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: A summary of what the book "The Baby Business" by Debora L. Spar was about. Doctor Poonsak was so interested in the content of the book that he translated this for free and donated the income to charity. We intended to make a podcast episode for each chapter in the book. You may also follow Dr.Poonsak at http://www.twitter.com/DrPoonsak
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor: 36. Correction on Contraception
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: We continued some discussions on the previous episode due to our fans feedback. Also, as Dr.Phattaraphum pointed out, the topic should be contraception rather than sterilization. He expanded on his experience during medical school days on how everyone had to go through an oral exam, explaining verbally on how to perform contraception to an imaginary patient.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor: 35. Sterilization
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Back to popular demand (I know, it ain't that popular, but it helped boosting our ego!). From our webboard post, we talked about a topic that was directly opposite to what our Doctor Nueng did for a living (in case you did not know, our doctor specialized in infertility). We talked about sterilization.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor: 34. Impossible
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Don't believe everything you see on TV is a valid argument. After having seen enough, Dr. Nueng gave an observation on what he saw on TV that he thought it was not realistic from a doctor's point of view. This was a light episode and meant to give some smiles to his fans.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor: 33. Cesarean Birth
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: From a topic on our webboard, we answered it and went on to discuss more. We had an episode on natural birth before and meant to talk about Cesarean birth later but somehow did not manage. So this time, we talked at full length about it and it took us almost an hour to cover this. Mor Neung explained in details what one had to go through for this type of operation.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor: 32. Menstrual Disorder
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: We discussed about the symptom, menstrual disorder; what could possibly cause it. These discussions were quite weird since both speakers were male! We wish we could have a female moderator for these topics.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor: 31. Blood Donation
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: From a post at our webboard, this led us to discuss about it. Mor Nueng gave a overview of the donation, though, he was not a specialist on the topic, but knowledgeable enough to contribute to the topic in question.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor: 30. Higher Education, Doctor's Pay and Vaginal Discharge
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Our doctor was wondering if he should get an MBA, so we touched a little bit on the subject and went on to talk about payment structure for doctors. And finishing off the episode on a traditional heath topic! We talked about vaginal discharge.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 29: Cyst
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: A sequence to the previous episode. A somewhat close cousin to fibroid is cyst. We also discussed it sometime was called chocolate cyst. This was another common disease found in women.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 28: Fibroid
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: One of the hardest-to-spell episode topic! Dr.Phattaraphum explained Myoma Uteri or commonly called Fibroid. It was an enjoyable conversation as he patiently explained the cause, symtoms and how to take care of it. One of the more interesting topic during the conversation was when he had to decide whether he should go ahead with an operation or retreat to some other alternative.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 27: Natural Birth
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Mor Nueng told what a mother had to go through during 12hrs before a child was born. Passakorn also shared his experience on his fatherhood. This was something a mother-and-father-to-be should know before the birthday.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 26: Commonly-found Diseases during Pregnancy 4 - Heart Disease
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: For the fourth and final episode in the series, Dr.Phattaraphum and Passakorn talked about heart disease, HPV vaccine and some other concerns rather than the four mentioned diseases.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 25: Commonly-found Diseases during Pregnancy 3 - Anemia
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: For the third episode in the series, Dr.Phattaraphum and Passakorn talked about anemia and also, on a related issue, Thalassemia.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 24: Commonly-found Diseases during Pregnancy 2 - Hypertension
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: We started a series of common-found diseasese during pregnancy. For the second episode in the series, we talked about hypertension.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 23: Commonly-found Diseases during Pregnancy 1 - Diabetic
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: We started a series of common-found diseasese during pregnancy. For the first episode in the series, we talked about diabetic.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 22: Mor Jiew on TV
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee
item.itunes:summary: At the time of this writing, we could not find which channel and what program this was, we would update this as soon as we know the info. Our Dr.Poonsak appeared on 5 episodes, each episode was only for 5 minutes, so we decided to release all five in this episodes, we only used the audio part. The content was quite general and some were what we discussed before.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 21: SMC Fertility Center
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Chalermporn (Ning) and Dr.Poonsak (Mor Jiew)
item.itunes:summary: We took the opportunity of using the place to record the podcasts to show you his clinic as well. It is very impressive and clean. The most impressive part is the room that's prepared for collecting sperms, it's like a hotel room. See it yourself!
item.itunes:keywords: Ultrasound, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Poonsak Waikwamdee, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 20: Ultrasound VDO
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Chalermporn (Ning) and Dr.Poonsak (Mor Jiew)
item.itunes:summary: Mor Jiew explained what one saw in ultrasound video. Chalermporn Kaoian graciously accepted the show host position, and she did well. This was one of the hardest episode to produce, so many trials-and-errors went into this.
item.itunes:keywords: Ultrasound, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Poonsak Waikwamdee, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 19: first VDO episode
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Chalermporn (Ning) and Dr.Poonsak (Mor Jiew)
item.itunes:summary: This was supposedly the second video episode, but due to editing problem, we decided to release this for this week. This was a Q and A session about what a couple should prepare or know before coming to see a doctor when they had problem conceiving a baby.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Poonsak Waikwamdee, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 18: Siamese Twins
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng and Passakorn on delivering such case
item.itunes:summary: Having seen the news about the operation on separating a Siamese twins at Siriraj lately, we decided to talk a little bit about it. Mor Nueng, in facts, had a personal experience in delivering such a case. The other half of the discussion was talking about a doctor's life.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Phattaraphum, Doctor, Siamese Twins

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 17: Seminar Doctor Style
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng just went to a seminar in Japan
item.itunes:summary: If you want to know what a medical doctor seminar was like, here was a glimpse of it. Mor Nueng went to Japan in March for a seminar, with quite a large group.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Phattaraphum, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui and Mor 16: Mor Nueng in UK
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Mor Nueng won a fellowship to UK. The discussion was more of an acedemic one, rather than a general discussion. Listen to how he was accecpted and went to London, very much, blind-folded. He also had a chance to finish a master degree during his tenure there. This was probably the last episdoe on life as a doctor.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Phattaraphum, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui Kab Mor 15: The Residence Years
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: Mor Nueng told his experience during the years. It was somewhat new to him since he only delivered just one baby during his first 3 years being a doctor. Then he had to come back to further his study to become an OB/GYN. Again, doctors always had stories to tell, and this episode was no different.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Phattaraphum, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui Kab Mor 14: 3 Years as an Army Doctor
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng and Passakorn
item.itunes:summary: 3 years in an army hospital, in Chonburi over a decade ago, Mor Nueng told us all about it. It was not exactly exciting, but it was entertaining. Mor Nueng had a unique way of punishing enlisted soldiers, who were infected with venereal disease when they went back home during breaks.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Phattaraphum, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui Kab Mor 13: Medical Majors by Mor Jiew
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Jiew and Ben, Our Big Fan
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Jiew explanined about various medical majors, how intense surgeon jobs can be. Also, he once had a friend who studied medical school in UK and came to Thailand for internships. And it was a surprise to see how many operations a thai medical student had to operate in a day.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Mor Jiew, Doctor

item.title: Changkhui Kab Mor 12: 1st Year as Doctors
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng and Mor Jiew on Their First Years
item.itunes:summary: What a nice surprise, Mor Jiew joined us this time after being absence for 3 months. Mor Nueng and Mor Jiew shared their experiences during their first years being doctors. Ironically, the two went to Chonburi during the years, though about 10 years apart. They also talked about why they picked OB/GYN as their specialties. Mor Jiew also told a story when he lost his friend during their years in school.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Siriraj, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast, Mor Jiew

item.title: Changkhui Kab Mor 11 - Medical Students 2
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng shared his student life experience during year 4, 5 and 6.
item.itunes:summary: This time Mor Nueng told us about the final 3 years. Virtually, no class room but lots and lots of residence hours.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Siriraj, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Changkhui Kab Mor 10 - Medical Students 1
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Nueng shared his student life experience
item.itunes:summary: Look who is back. It's Mor Nueng. Inspired by the TV program, Kob Nok Kala, we discussed what a medical student had to go through for 6 six years at medical school. It was a fun discussion. This episode only covered year 1 to 4. You had to wait for the next episode for year 4 to 6.
item.itunes:keywords: medical school, Siriraj, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Rud 2 - Accidents Happened
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Mor Rud commented on dentist incidents that made headlines.
item.itunes:summary: Mor Rud, a dentist, commented on what he saw on headlines news. These were accidents that the aftermath went out of control.
item.itunes:keywords: Dentistry, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Rud 1 - Extreme Makeover
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Comment from a dentist about the TV program Extreme Makeover
item.itunes:summary: Mor Rud, a dentist, commented on what he saw on the program Extreme Makeover and what he experienced at the hospital.
item.itunes:keywords: Dentistry, Extreme Makeover, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Jiew 7 - Questions from Pantip
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Recorded questions from Pantip
item.itunes:summary: We took questions from the family room in Pantip.com to both doctors.
item.itunes:keywords: OB/GYN, Women Health, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Jiew 6 - Questions from a mother-to-be
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Recorded questions from a mother
item.itunes:summary: A mother-to-be asked questions about a belief about going up and down the stairs, bikini-strip operation and whether she should get her doctor mobile number.
item.itunes:keywords: OB/GYN, Women Health, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Jiew 5 - Occupation Hazard
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: It happens, it comes with the territory.
item.itunes:summary: Hard to believe that working with pregnant women could cause physical damage, Dr.Jiew took it on the light side and shared his story. Also, his experience in delivering his own baby boy. And a side effect from taping one's child birth on VDO.
item.itunes:keywords: OB/GYN, Women Health, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Jiew 4 - a doctor's life and a topic about internal check-up
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Jiew told a little about himself
item.itunes:summary: This time we have a new host, Khun Ning. She managed to get Dr.Jiew to tell us a doctor's life. Also, she asked about internal check-up for women.
item.itunes:keywords: OB/GYN, Women Health, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Jiew 3 - AIDS patient, Superstition
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Jiew and Dr.Phattaraphum answer questions about AIDS
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Jiew and Dr.Phattaraphum Phophong answered if an AIDS/HIV+ patient can have a children, how Thai's superstition can risk a child's life Here are the answers.
item.itunes:keywords: OB/GYN, Women Health, Medicine, Thai, Thai Podcast

item.title: Mor Jiew 2 - Gender Selection
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Jiew answered questions about child gender
item.itunes:summary: Is it possible to conceive a child without a husband? Legality, practical aspect and the doctor opinion. Is it possible to predetermine a child gender in both natural and doctor-assisted methods. Here are the answers.
item.itunes:keywords: OB/GYN, Women Health, Medicine, Thai

item.title: Q and A with Mor Jiew - Introduction
item.itunes:author: Passakorn Hongsyok
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee and Passakorn Hongsyok with Q and A
item.itunes:summary: Dr.Poonsak Waikwamdee is generous enough to host this program for us. He is an Ob-Gyn (Women Health) with 18 years of experience. For the first few episodes, Passakorn will be co-hosting until we are able to find a more suitable person.
item.itunes:keywords: OB/GYN, Women Health, Medicine, Thai
